To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
> This looks like the wrong approach to me; what you call `coeMonoidHom` is usually called `map`, and most `map` definitions actually fall out as a special case of `lift`:

Thanks, I have refactored it as suggested. Since the names `WithZero.map` and `WithZero.lift` are already taken (for additive maps), I have used `WithZero.map'` and`WithZero.lift'`, but please let me know if you have other naming suggestions.
`mapMonoidHom` and `liftMonoidHom` would also be good names. Perhaps we should rename the existing defs in the same style, rather than picking favorites with `'`?
Looking more closely, I think the primed name is ok. Can you copy across some of the other API for the unprimed version?
maintainer merge

* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#12351~~

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

This looks like the wrong approach to me; what you call `coeMonoidHom` is usually called `map`, and most `map` definitions actually fall out as a special case of `lift`:
```lean
/-- Coercion as a monoid hom -/
@[simps]
def coeMonoidHom [MulOneClass G] : G â†’* WithZero G where
  toFun := (â†‘)
  map_one' := rfl
  map_mul' _ _ := rfl

/-- The (multiplicative) universal property of `WithZero` -/
noncomputable nonrec def lift [Monoid G] [MonoidWithZero H] :
    (G â†’* H) â‰ƒ (WithZero G â†’*â‚€ H) where
  toFun f :=
    { toFun := fun
        | 0 => 0
        | (g : G) => f g
      map_zero' := rfl
      map_one' := map_one f
      map_mul' := fun
        | 0, _ => (zero_mul _).symm
        | (_ : G), 0 => (mul_zero _).symm
        | (_ : G), (_ : G) => map_mul f _ _ }
  invFun F := F.toMonoidHom.comp coeMonoidHom
  left_inv _ := rfl
  right_inv f := DFunLike.ext _ _ fun
    | 0 => (map_zero f).symm
    | (_ : G) => rfl
```

This looks like the wrong approach to me; what you call `coeMonoidHom` is usually called `map`, and most `map` definitions actually fall out as a special case of `lift`:
```lean

@[simps]
def coeMonoidHom [MulOneClass G] : G â†’* WithZero G where
  toFun := (â†‘)
  map_one' := rfl
  map_mul' _ _ := rfl

/-- The (multiplicative) universal property of `WithZero` -/
noncomputable nonrec def lift [Monoid G] [MonoidWithZero H] :
    (G â†’* H) â‰ƒ (WithZero G â†’*â‚€ H) where
  toFun f :=
    { toFun := fun
        | 0 => 0
        | (g : G) => f g
      map_zero' := rfl
      map_one' := map_one f
      map_mul' := fun
        | 0, _ => (zero_mul _).symm
        | (_ : G), 0 => (mul_zero _).symm
        | (_ : G), (_ : G) => map_mul f _ _ }
  invFun F := F.toMonoidHom.comp coeMonoidHom
  left_inv _ := rfl
  right_inv f := DFunLike.ext _ _ fun
    | 0 => (map_zero f).symm
    | (_ : G) => rfl
```

nodes.body:
This looks like the wrong approach to me; what you call `coeMonoidHom` is usually called `map`, and most `map` definitions actually fall out as a special case of `lift`:
```lean
/-- Coercion as a monoid hom -/
@[simps]
def coeMonoidHom [MulOneClass G] : G â†’* WithZero G where
  toFun := (â†‘)
  map_one' := rfl
  map_mul' _ _ := rfl

/-- The (multiplicative) universal property of `WithZero` -/
noncomputable nonrec def lift [Monoid G] [MonoidWithZero H] :
    (G â†’* H) â‰ƒ (WithZero G â†’*â‚€ H) where
  toFun f :=
    { toFun := fun
        | 0 => 0
        | (g : G) => f g
      map_zero' := rfl
      map_one' := map_one f
      map_mul' := fun
        | 0, _ => (zero_mul _).symm
        | (_ : G), 0 => (mul_zero _).symm
        | (_ : G), (_ : G) => map_mul f _ _ }
  invFun F := F.toMonoidHom.comp coeMonoidHom
  left_inv _ := rfl
  right_inv f := DFunLike.ext _ _ fun
    | 0 => (map_zero f).symm
    | (_ : G) => rfl
```

> This looks like the wrong approach to me; what you call `coeMonoidHom` is usually called `map`, and most `map` definitions actually fall out as a special case of `lift`:

Thanks, I have refactored it as suggested. Since the names `WithZero.map` and `WithZero.lift` are already taken (for additive maps), I have used `WithZero.map'` and`WithZero.lift'`, but please let me know if you have other naming suggestions.
`mapMonoidHom` and `liftMonoidHom` would also be good names. Perhaps we should rename the existing defs in the same style, rather than picking favorites with `'`?
Looking more closely, I think the primed name is ok. Can you copy across some of the other API for the unprimed version?
